engineering_design_principles.mechanism: The theory of cosmic inflation addresses issues such as the horizon problem and flatness problem in the early universe.
A negative-pressure vacuum energy density, or dark energy, drives the rapid, accelerated expansion of the universe.
The scale factor increases exponentially with time, leading to rapid inflation of the universe.

The homogeneity and isotropy of the universe are preserved during the period of inflation, leading to the uniformity of the cosmic microwave background radiation and the large-scale structure of the universe.
